website_summaries.verdict: The Riva Arena is a likable Chromecast speaker with a portable option, but its not quite as sophisticated as its rivals.
pros: The Riva Arena is the first truly portable Chromecast built-in speaker
It offers decent sound quality and a number of useful features, including device charging, splash-proofing and direct Wi-Fi connectivity
cons: The speaker can sound a little boxy and unfocused at times
The Sonos Play:1 and the cheaper Denon Heos 1 both sound better

customer_reviews.title: Best speaker in this price range
customer_reviews.text: very happy with my purchase. It's awesome to come home from work, pop on some tunes and relax with this speaker. This little thing can definitely output some serious volume with little effort. It's got great range and can definitely accommodate any type of music you throw at it. Straight out of the box, i was up and running within 10 minutes. the set up would have been quicker but i got distracted playing around with some advanced settings. And with the portable battery pack, it's nice to have the option of taking the speaker outdoors. Great sounds, great price, easy to use. What else could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Kenji Yanagisawa

customer_reviews.title: No Power button to turn Unit On & Off - Only Problem
customer_reviews.text: This speaker sounds great. I’ve compared a whole lot of them @ my local Best Buy & went with this one at the end. But... there’s no power button to turn the unit on & off. I hate that with a passion. No sleep mode either, so the mini Amp in the back will be warm enough after leaving it on for a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Gift 2 Me

customer_reviews.title: Lemons
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it was great. Have not heard back from customer service to fix the speaker after it stopped working after 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: K CB

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Could be louder. Havent been able to integrate with Alexa
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Sound System
customer_reviews.text: The Riva Arena speaker is very easy to set up. Music is streamed through wifi and the sound quality is much better than Amazon Echo and Bluetooth speakers. Very happy about this purchase and can't wait to enjoy lots of great music through my Riva!
customer_reviews.author: mz

customer_reviews.title: My friend recommended the RIVA speaker and I loved it
customer_reviews.text: My friend recommended the RIVA speaker and I loved it. It's an amazing wifi speaker with great sound quality. Easy to link to our home network and user friendly to younger kids. It's great for kid's rooms because they can have the music without a smartphone or iPad nearby, unlike a bluetooth speaker. My first RIVA speaker is in my son's room for sleeping music. I'm planning to purchase couple more for my daughter's room and kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, small size.
customer_reviews.text: This speaker punches way above its weight. Hard to believe a small speaker this small can put out such great sound. Good looking too. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it, but purchase cannot do price match, and have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Live Young

customer_reviews.title: Every bit as good as stated in the reviews
customer_reviews.text: Seriously good sound quality. I'm a long-time audio pro and expert in evaluating sound reproduction, and did not have to listen around any problems with this item. Quantity is also impressive lots of volume without evident strain. Setup was effortless.
customer_reviews.author: Kong

customer_reviews.title: Skip it if you intend to cast from Spotify or other streaming servixeg
customer_reviews.text: It stopped casting via Spotify after less than six months. The Spotify integration was 90% of the reason I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Fargonaut

customer_reviews.title: 00 this would be a great sounding unit but for 250
customer_reviews.text: at 100.00 this would be a great sounding unit but for 250.00 Im a little disappointed. Sound is good at lower volume but cranked up you can hear the amp working hard. My 65.00$ Creative Logic computer speakers have better sound. I purchased the battery also as I wanted portability so I have decided to keep it. Nice not to mess with all the cords.
customer_reviews.author: patricia n. haigh

customer_reviews.title: Same great sound quality as the TurboX!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the sound quality and ease of use with the Arena. I have the Bluetooth enabled TurboX and love it. As I was interested in going WiFi based for my upstairs bedroom, I decided to try the Arena and couldn’t be happier. I can easily play my Amazon Prime music stations!
customer_reviews.author: L.J.

customer_reviews.title: Most versatile speaker ever!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome speaker!!! can be used with Bluetooth, Spotify connect and Chromecast, I've been using it every day since Christmas and couldn't be happier, awesome product
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Non-standard speaker mount
customer_reviews.text: The speaker itself is decent, though a little pricey. However, if you plan to wall mount the speaker, you cannot. It doesn't have a standard 1/4 in mount.
customer_reviews.author: Ninove

customer_reviews.title: In this price range? The Best.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried Bose, Sonos, B&O etc. None of those hold a candle to this in terms of sound quality at this size and price range. If you are buying in this range, I'd say you owe it to yourself to try Riva. In addition to sound quality, very well thought out and comprehensive in terms of connectivity (although i just use it with my Echo Dot - and of course vs. an Echo Dot's own speakers, there is literally no comparison in terms of sound quality). I have not tried the Riva Festival yet but am now tempted to try it given my experience with the Arena - although I should probably get a bigger condo first.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm88

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Connection & Power Up
customer_reviews.text: After two months with this speaker I started having issues with this not being seen by my network and also will not power up. After several days and attempts to get power, it finally started, I then quickly performed a firmware update hoping it would fix these issues. The next day, same thing, no connection/no power. It can take from 20 minutes to over four hours to power up and connect. This happens everyday now. I tried to contact Riva direct, they will not respond to either voice mail or e-mail, only Amazon was able to help on the warranty/return claim. Otherwise, the speaker sounds great and was exactly what I needed for backyard portabiliity. I just wish it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P Konefal

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless Chomecast speaker under $250.
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless speaker with option of battery pack to make it truly wireless. Google chromecast makes wifi connection easy and I can also connect via Spotify Connect and Tidal connect. Best thing about this speaker is the audio quality. Quite simply the best I've heard for under $250. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ajgj

customer_reviews.title: Bravo to the Sound of RIVA CONCERT!!
customer_reviews.text: My new RIVA Concert is incredible! I recently went to hear the Beijing Duo Meng Su and Yameng Wang live in concert, and, when I listened to their CD on RIVA Concert it was like I was back in the first row of their concert! Knock out sound quality . I recommend it to the most discerning music lovers!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Acevedo

customer_reviews.title: Superior sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Stumbled onto Riva after reading some reviews and I'm glad I did. Hands down the best sounding wifi speaker I've ever listened to. Streaks ahead of Sonos and other speakers of a similar price point. Don't waste your time with anything else. I know I won't be.
customer_reviews.author: Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Mine was a dud
customer_reviews.text: It connected via wifi and worked for about 1 minute, but started playing multiple songs simultaneously via Pandora. Then it would no longer connect via wifi. Then it would no longer even power up. All of this within minutes. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Dean B

customer_reviews.title: Out of business?
customer_reviews.text: Riva will not answer phones or emails. I was wanting to return an item and cannot get anyone to answer. Out of business? Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: djbrady33

Stream your favorite music, including High-Resolution audio up to 24-bit/192kHz, from Spotify, Pandora, Tidal, YouTube, local content, media servers and many more!
